Here's Litecoin compared to Bitcoin Cash (Bcash). BCH's equipment cost is only 58% of Litecoin's, and it cost a bit more electricity to secure. Yet, the marketcap is 3x larger. The other problem with BCH security is the risk of Bitcoin miners attacking. Litecoin not affected. pic.twitter.com/MBcBNYmrxX

Here's my analysis for Litecoin mining stats compared to Bitcoin. Left image is from January of last year. Security of network can be measured by equipment cost and electricity protecting the network. Bitcoin used to be 25x/69x a year ago. Now it's only 4.4x/8.8x more secure. pic.twitter.com/n2jXn14095

I'd say there is also a pretty strong incentive to exploit hardware-level vulns as well. These things take time to come to the surface, though. Crypto networks are very young.

If these Meldown/Spectre exploits exist in a decade worth of reputable hardware, just imagine what we'll be finding in cryptocurrencies and smart contract VMs in the future. We'll see if code == law when all the Wall St. folks entering the space lose their money in a hack.
